_180_Degree_Adapter.title: 180 Degree Adapter
_180_Degree_Adapter.description: Provides a right-angle connector for hardline cable.
_180_Degree_Adapter.html: The 180 Degree Adapter helps to connect the hardline to devices when working in tight spaces.

_180_Degree_Socket_Adapter.title: 180 Degree Socket Adapter
_180_Degree_Socket_Adapter.description: Connects hardline cable to devices when working in tight spaces.

Active_Combiner.title: Active Combiner
Active_Combiner.description: Combines the channel output signals of the video and audio devices and adds program-specific information.

Aerial_Drop_Clamp.title: Aerial Drop Clamp
Aerial_Drop_Clamp.description: Secures the drop to the span in a way that allows for expansion.

Amplifier.title: Amplifier
Amplifier.description: Rebuilds the original RF signal from the node, correcting RF signal degradation caused by transport through the hardline cable. Combines and amplifies carriers on the return and transmits them to the node.
Amplifier.html:
The goal of amplifiers is to maintain unity gain across the coaxial plant. Amplifiers are found on the express cable (trunk); bridge the RF onto multiple legs (bridger and mini-bridger), and extend the signal to end-of-line (EOL) customers (line extenders). Learn more...
  • How does an amp work?
  • Try it! Relate design to operation.
  • Trunk and Bridger Amps from DFC
  • Line Extenders from DFC

Amplifier_Module.title: Amplifier Module
Amplifier_Module.description: Houses the active electronics inside the amplifier case.
Amplifier_Module.html: The amplifier module is easily replaced in the event of damage or failure

Barrel_Connector.title: Barrel Connector
Barrel_Connector.description: Provides the physical interface for the short cable connecting to the DVR, MOCA Node, DTA, or Cable Modem.
Barrel_Connector.html: The barrel connector is a splice, built with a brass insert to connect the center conductors together and a dielectric.

Bi-Directional_Amplifier.title: Bi-Directional Amplifier
Bi-Directional_Amplifier.description: Amplifies the downstream RF energy to meet specified signal levels in order to operate the CPE.
Bi-Directional_Amplifier.html: Amplifies the downstream and allows the upstream to pass. The amplifier is installed inside and powered using an AC/DC power block. Power runs over the coax inside wire.

Bonding_Block.title: Bonding Block
Bonding_Block.description: Provides the interface between the drop and the customer's inside wire and bonds to the building grounding system to protect against shock and damage from electrical surges.
Bonding_Block.html: Bonding blocks are sometimes still called "ground blocks." The block acts as a test point and protects the OSP and the customer's equipment.

Bonding_Clamp.title: Bonding Clamp
Bonding_Clamp.description: Clamps the building wire to the strand.
Bonding_Clamp.html: The bonding clamp is designed to minimize electrolytic corrosion caused by bonding copper to steel. It is essential for electrical safety.

Bonding_Wire.title: Bonding Wire
Bonding_Wire.description: Carries excess voltage to the building's ground system. Bonding wire is designed to carry voltage from surges like lightning.
Bonding_Wire.html: Bonding to ground is a critical element of all subscriber installations.

Building_Wire.title: Building Wire
Building_Wire.description: Bonds the strand to a ground rod to protect the devices and technicians from electrical shock.
Building_Wire.html: Building wire is also called riser bond and is available in large gauge 4AWG and 8AWG. Building wire is clamped to the strand and run through the riser to a ground rod at the base of the pole.

Cable_Modem.title: Cable Modem
Cable_Modem.description: Provides high-speed Internet services using DOCSIS.
Cable_Modem.html:
Learn more about cable modems and gateways (includes telephone jacks)
  • Arris Cable Modem and Gateway Quick-Start guides
  • What is the IoT?
  • How do Internet cameras work?
  • What is WiFi?
  • What are WiFi boosters, repeaters, and extenders?
  • What's new in WiFi?
  • How can I troubleshoot my Internet connection?
  • How can I change the settings on the cable modem?

CATV_Wall_Outlet.title: CATV Wall Outlet
CATV_Wall_Outlet.description: Demarcs the inside wire at the wall.
CATV_Wall_Outlet.html: Also called a TV Wall Plate, the faceplate includes a barrel connector, threaded at both ends.

CCAP_CMTS.title: CCAP/CMTS
CCAP_CMTS.description: The Converged Cable Access Platform (CCAP)/Cable Modem Termination System (CMTS) control the modulation and demodulation of digital RF carriers.
CCAP_CMTS.html:
Learn more about CCAP/CMTS...
  • Discover the role of the headend and hub
  • SCTE's IP Engineering Professional course
  • CCAP and the headend

Cherry_Picker_MUX.title: Cherry Picker/MUX
Cherry_Picker_MUX.description: Assembles and interleaves the MPEG2 transport streams into each of the digital carriers.
Cherry_Picker_MUX.html: The device is commonly called a "Cherry Picker" because it picks and organizes the program streams into the channel lineup.

Compression_F-Connector.title: Compression F-Connector
Compression_F-Connector.description: Connects drop cable and inside wire to bonding blocks, splitters, and equipment.
Compression_F-Connector.html: Compression connectors used outside often have rubber grommets to provide a watertight seal. The compression fitting is designed to secure the cable's sheath without deforming the dielectric foam insulation.

DC_Power_Inserter.title: DC Power Inserter
DC_Power_Inserter.description: Injects DC to power a bi-directional amplifier.

Demodulator.title: Demodulator
Demodulator.description: Converts video and audio RF signals to baseband.
Demodulator.html: The demodulator's baseband output can be SD or HD. The output signal is inserted into the multiplexer through the router.

Digital_Terminal_Adapter.title: Digital Terminal Adapter
Digital_Terminal_Adapter.description: The Digital Terminal Adapter (DTA) decodes the digital programming so it can be displayed on a TV.
Digital_Terminal_Adapter.html: With a coaxial input, the DTA processes the digital data to output HDMI (HD models), Composite, or IF Baseband (Channel 3/4).

Digital_Video_Recorder.title: Digital Video Recorder
Digital_Video_Recorder.description: The Digital Video Recorder (DVR)Decodes the digital audio and video for display on a TV. Also records and stores the programming for playback at a later time.
Digital_Video_Recorder.html: A DVR, also called a Digital Video Recorder, receives a channel guide which is loaded on the box. It also transmits status messages to a set top box monitoring server.

Fiber_Demarcation_Enclosure.title: Fiber Demarcation Enclosure
Fiber_Demarcation_Enclosure.description: Houses the physical interface between the fiber drop and the customer's inside wire.
Fiber_Demarcation_Enclosure.html: Also called a network interface unit (NIU), network interface device (NID), and house box, the enclosure protects the bonding block, connectors, and /or splitters from the elements.

Drop_Cable.title: Drop Cable
Drop_Cable.description: Transports the signals for voice, video, and data between the tap and the demarc. In RF demarcs the drop cable is coaxial (RG6 or RG11) and runs from the tap to the demarc. In FTTH demarcs, the drop cable is low count fiber and a short RG6 drop is used inside the demarc between the ONU and the inside wire. Drop cables are identified by drop tags.
Drop_Cable.html:
Learn about drop cables...
  • Fiberoptic drop cables from FS
  • Coaxial drop cable from Commscope

Drop_Tag.title: Drop Tag
Drop_Tag.description: Identifies the assigned subscriber and service status [active/disconnected/filtered] for the tagged drop cable.
Drop_Tag.html: Drop tags come in different colors to identify the type of drop and the customer it serves.

E_Span_Clamp.title: E Span Clamp
E_Span_Clamp.description: Secures the drop along the span.
E_Span_Clamp.html: Also referred to as a mid-span clamp, the E Span Clamp is one of a number of clamps used to secure the drop cable to the strand and position it away from driveways and property lines.

Emergency_Alert_System_EAS_Antenna.title: Emergency Alert System (EAS) Antenna
Emergency_Alert_System_EAS_Antenna.description: Receives the EAS public safety broadcasts that activate the EAS system in the headend.

Emergency_Alert_System_EAS_Controller.title: Emergency Alert System (EAS) Controller
Emergency_Alert_System_EAS_Controller.description: Activates upon receipt of an EAS broadcast and interrupts all transport streams and inserts the audio and text message.

Equalizer.title: Equalizer
Equalizer.description: Adjusts the gain in the lower, middle, and upper frequency bands in amplifiers.
Equalizer.html: Equalizer modules vary in form factor depending on the vendor and model of the amplifier.

FTTH_Demarc.title: FTTH Demarc
FTTH_Demarc.description: Houses the components used to interface the fiber drop to the customer's inside wire.
FTTH_Demarc.html:
The fiber-to-the-home (FTTH) demarc is a weather-resistant enclosure that houses the components used to connect the OSP to the customer’s inside wire. The drop is fiberoptic cable. In an RFoG Demarc, a mini-node optical network unit (ONU) converts light to RF (downstream) and RF to light (upstream).
  • Check out this RFoG enclosure from Alpha
  • RFoG explained

Fiber_Mux_Demux.title: Fiber Mux/Demux
Fiber_Mux_Demux.description: Combines (Mux) multiple optical signals onto a single fiber. Breaks out (Demux) multiple optical signals from a single fiber.
Fiber_Mux_Demux.html:
Find out more about Mux/Demux units...
  • Commscope Dual LGX Module Wavelength Division Multiplexer
  • Commscope FTTX Brightpath Solutions

Fiber_Patch_Panel.title: Fiber Patch Panel
Fiber_Patch_Panel.description: Cross connects optical devices such as ONUs, ONTs, and nodes to the correct fiber or wavelength associated with that device.

Fiber_Pigtail.title: Fiber Pigtail
Fiber_Pigtail.description: Provides a connector to insert into the optical network unit (ONU). The pigtail is spliced onto the fiberoptic drop cable.
Fiber_Pigtail.html:
Unterminated fiber needs a pigtail spliced onto it. Learn more...
  • Types of connectors - APC vs. UPC
  • A great view of an SC-APC pigtail from European supplier Dipol

Fiber_Splice.title: Fiber Splice
Fiber_Splice.description: Secures the interface (fusion or mechanical) between the fiber drop and pigtail.

Fiber_Splice_Tray.title: Fiber Splice Tray
Fiber_Splice_Tray.description: Houses and secures the fusion splices between the feeder and the fiberoptic patch cords.

Fiber_Wraparound_Marker.title: Fiber Wraparound Marker
Fiber_Wraparound_Marker.description: Identifies the fiberoptic cable among other similar-looking cables
Fiber_Wraparound_Marker.html: Available in orange to wrap around fiberoptic cables in 4" and 8" lengths. May be labelled or plain.

Fiberoptic_Cabinet.title: Fiberoptic Cabinet
Fiberoptic_Cabinet.description: Houses fiber termination equipment in a secure cabinet.
Fiberoptic_Cabinet.html:
Learn more about fiberoptic communications...
  • Clearfield Cabinets

Fiberoptic_Cable.title: Fiberoptic Cable
Fiberoptic_Cable.description: Carries video, voice, and data traffic as encoded pulses of infrared laser light between the headend, hubs, nodes, optical line terminals (OLT), and other fiberoptic equipment.
Fiberoptic_Cable.html:
Learn more about fiberoptics...
  • SCTE/ISBE FTTx 99 Explainer
  • Discover how we use fiber in the OSP
  • RF over Glass
  • Inspecting and cleaning fiber
  • Commscope Fiber Catalog
  • SCUPC vs. SCAPC Connectors
  • How do we splice fiberoptic cable?

Fuse.title: Fuse
Fuse.description: Protects amplifiers from damage due to an electrical fault.
Fuse.html: Fuses are available in different form factors depending on the vendor and model of the amplifier.

Game_Console.title: Game Console
Game_Console.description: Delivers interactive gaming to the customer.
Game_Console.html:
Learn more...
  • What is the XBox?
  • What is the PlayStation?

Hardline_Cable.title: Hardline Cable
Hardline_Cable.description: Provides the backbone of the coaxial distribution system to transport (RF) signals and AC voltage among nodes, amplifiers, taps, and standby power supplies.
Hardline_Cable.html:
Learn more...
  • DOCSIS 3.1 Overview 99 Primer
  • What is the topology of hardline cable?
  • Try it! Identify Hardline Topologies
  • What are the components of a hardline cable?
  • Commscope Hardline Cable

Hardline_Connector.title: Hardline Connector
Hardline_Connector.description: Provides a secure, watertight connection between a hardline cable and nodes, amplifiers, and taps.
Hardline_Connector.html: Available in 2- and 3-piece connectors; installed and tightened down with a seizure screw inside the housing

Hardline_Splitter.title: Hardline Splitter
Hardline_Splitter.description: Splits the signal on the hardline cable.
Hardline_Splitter.html: The hardline splitter acts as both a splitter for the downstream RF carriers and combiner for the upstream RF carriers.

Headend.title: Headend
Headend.description: Connects the hubs and nodes over fiberoptic cable to video, voice, and data services. The headend facility houses electronic equipment to receive, process, and transmit data, and may use local over-the-air (OTA) antennas and television receive-only (TVRO) satellite dishes.
Headend.html: • SCTE/ISBE: Headend Facilities

Hub.title: Hub
Hub.description: Houses CATV gear to provide video, voice and data services closer to the subscribers.
Hub.html: Hubs are connected to a regional headend with fiberoptic cable and may include Edge QAMs, combiners, laser transmitters and receivers, and other CATV equipment.

In-Span_Fiber_Slack_Storage.title: In-Span Fiber Slack Storage
In-Span_Fiber_Slack_Storage.description: Stores fiberoptic cable hanging from the strand.
In-Span_Fiber_Slack_Storage.html: Used in pairs, in-span fiber slack storage, such as the Multilink Sno-Shoe®, stores additional fiberoptic cable (slack), allowing the splice case to be moved into a trailer.

Inside_Wire.title: Inside Wire
Inside_Wire.description: Carries RF signals between the RF Demarc to the cable outlets inside the customer premises.
Inside_Wire.html: Inside wire should be RG6 but older installations may be RG59, which has a higher attenuation across the spectrum.

Integrated_Receiver_Transcoder.title: Integrated Receiver Transcoder
Integrated_Receiver_Transcoder.description: The Integrated Receiver Transcoder (IRT) converts the incoming signal from the TVRO antenna into a standard format, such as an MPEG2 transport stream, and outputs over ASI or GigE.
Integrated_Receiver_Transcoder.html:
Learn more..
  • How does the IRT work?

IP_Security_Camera.title: IP Security Camera
IP_Security_Camera.description: Operates over the Internet to monitor and record video and audio.
IP_Security_Camera.html: IP cameras (hard-wired and WiFi) are part of the growing trend in home automation.

Laser_Receiver.title: Laser Receiver
Laser_Receiver.description: Converts the optical pulses on the returns into RF signals.
Laser_Receiver.html:
Learn more..
  • Are there different types of laser receivers?
  • How do laser receivers work?

Laser_Transmitter.title: Laser Transmitter
Laser_Transmitter.description: Converts the modulated RF carrier to optical pulses which are transmitted down the fiberoptic cable.
Laser_Transmitter.html:
Learn more..
  • Are there different types of laser transmitters?
  • How do laser transmitters work?

Lashing_Clamp.title: Lashing Clamp
Lashing_Clamp.description: Secures lashing wire to strand
Lashing_Clamp.html: Galvanized steel clamps are used to secure the lashing wire wrapped around the cables to the strand.

Lashing_Support_Strap.title: Lashing Support Strap
Lashing_Support_Strap.description: Straps hardline cable, drop cable, and fiberoptic cable to the strand.
Lashing_Support_Strap.html: Straps are used with spacers and are available in different lengths and widths to support individual cables or bundles.

MOCA_Ethernet_Extender.title: MOCA Ethernet Extender
MOCA_Ethernet_Extender.description: Uses MOCA frequencies to encode and decode Ethernet frames using existing coax inside wire. The device is designed to extend a wired Ethernet port from the cable modem or gateway to a remote part of the customer's facility.
MOCA_Ethernet_Extender.html:
Learn more...
  • What is MOCA?
  • How do I install a MOCA local area network?
  • What is Ethernet?
  • What is an Ethernet port?
  • Are all Ethernet cables the same?

MOCA_WiFi_Extender.title: MOCA WiFi Extender
MOCA_WiFi_Extender.description: Uses MOCA frequencies to encode and decode Ethernet frames using existing coax inside wire. The device is designed to extend the WiFi service from the cable modem, router, or gateway device to remote areas of the customer's location.
MOCA_WiFi_Extender.html:
Learn more...
  • What is MOCA?
  • What's the best way to install a MOCA local area network?
  • What's WiFi?
  • What's a WiFi extender?

Network_Attached_Storage.title: Network Attached Storage
Network_Attached_Storage.description: Provides network-available storage and retrieval of large amounts of data such as videos, movies, pictures, and document files.
Network_Attached_Storage.html:
Learn more...
  • What is Network-attached Storage (NAS)?
  • Who makes NAS devices?
  • What is RAID?

Node.title: Node
Node.description: The node is the interface between the fiberoptic cable and the hardline cable in a HFC network. The node is an active device, meaning that it requires power from a power supply, inserted into the node by the power inserter.
Node.html:
Also known as an optical node, this device is the key component in an HFC network; a failure here will affect hundreds of customers. Noise from the customers funnel into the node and may affect its performance. Learn more...
  • Try it! Identify the role of the node.
  • Try it! Identify optical components
  • Try it! How does a node work?
  • Pace/Aurora Advanced Services Node

Over-the-Air_OTA_Antenna.title: Over-the-Air (OTA) Antenna
Over-the-Air_OTA_Antenna.description: Receives digital TV signals from local stations.
Over-the-Air_OTA_Antenna.html: The Over-the-Air (OTA) Antenna is mounted on a tower at the headend.

Optical_Network_Unit_ONU.title: Optical Network Unit ONU
Optical_Network_Unit_ONU.description: Converts light to RF and vice versa. Used in FTTH Demarc enclosures with RF over Glass (RFoG) topologies.
Optical_Network_Unit_ONU.html: The RFoG ONU acts as a mini node, converting optical signals in the downstream for voice, video, and data into RF, to be carried over the customer’s inside wire to the cable modem, gateway, or set top box. In the upstream, the ONU converts RF into optical signals to be carried back to the hub or headend over the fiberoptic cable.

Pad.title: Pad
Pad.description: Attenuates the signal as it passes through the amplifier module.
Pad.html: Pads are available in a number of dB values

Passive_Combiner.title: Passive Combiner
Passive_Combiner.description: Combines the channel output signals of the various video and audio devices.

Pedestal.title: Pedestal
Pedestal.description: Protects the active and passive devices connected to the underground plant via a tap.
Pedestal.html: Pedestals are typically two pieces, a stationary base and a removable cover. There are many types of underground-plant access points: Pedestals, hand-holds, and cabinets are just a few.

Power_Inserter.title: Power Inserter
Power_Inserter.description: Inserts AC power from the power supply onto the hardline cable.
Power_Inserter.html: Passively combines RF with up to 90VAC to power active electronics on the hardline cable.

Power_Supply.title: Power Supply
Power_Supply.description: Regulates utility power to provide clean AC power over hardline cable to active electronics in the OSP, such as nodes, amplifiers, and Wireless Hubs.
Power_Supply.html:
• The Alpha XM3-HP CableUPS
  • AlphaNet™ DM3 Series Transponder Installation Certification Course
  • AlphaNet™ DM3 Series Transponder Installation Quick Start Guide
  • Ride Along: Responding to a Power Supply Alarm
  • Safety Tip: Exploding Batteries
  • Activity: Battery Safety
  • Activity: Electrical Safety Tips for Power Supplies
  • Ride Along: Power Supply Components
  • Inside the Power Supply Cabinet
  • Activity: Identify Power Supply Cabinet Elements
  • Reviewing the Alpha XM2
  • The XM2 Functional Block Diagram
  • Transponder Functions
  • Activity: Transponder Functions
  • Activity: Power Supply Alarms

Power_Supply_Cabinet.title: Power Supply Cabinet
Power_Supply_Cabinet.description: Protects the power supply, batteries, and associated electronics.

QAM_Add_Drop_Inserter.title: QAM Add/Drop Inserter
QAM_Add_Drop_Inserter.description: Encodes analog and digital baseband signals and outputs an MPEG2 transport stream over GigE.

QAM_Modulator.title: QAM Modulator
QAM_Modulator.description: Uses the MPEG-2 digital transport stream, input using GigE, to modulate an RF carrier.
QAM_Modulator.html: QAM modulators are rack mounted. Each one controls where on the RF spectrum the QAM carrier is placed.

Receiver_Encoder.title: Receiver Encoder
Receiver_Encoder.description: Converts multiple formats of digital and analog video into an MPEG2 transport stream over a GigE interface.
Receiver_Encoder.html:
Learn more....
  • What are MPEG2, MPEG4, and the other digital video standards?
  • What are transport streams?
  • Some Analog to Digital Encoders
  • Some Digital Encoders

Regional_Operations_Center.title: Regional Operations Center
Regional_Operations_Center.description: Monitors and controls the status of signals, devices, and facilities.
Regional_Operations_Center.html:
Learn more...
  • What is a firewall?
  • What is a server?
  • What is a web server?
  • How does cable telephony work?
  • What is an electronic program guide?
  • Why are OSS/BSS important?
  • All about ACTI TVRO Antennas.
  • All about Althos Ad Insertion.
  • All about VOD from Edgeware.

Regulated_Power_Module.title: Regulated Power Module
Regulated_Power_Module.description: Converts AC to regulated DC in order to power the electronics.
Regulated_Power_Module.html: Power modules (power packs) are replaceable and vary in form factor depending on vendor and amplifier model.

RF_Combiner.title: RF Combiner
RF_Combiner.description: Combines the RF feeds from the QAM modulators, CMTS, and other RF equipment.
RF_Combiner.html:
Learn more...
  • Are there different types of combiners?
  • What frequencies are used?

RF_Demarc.title: RF Demarc
RF_Demarc.description: Houses the physical interface between the drop and the customer's inside wire.
RF_Demarc.html:
Learn more...
  • Why do we bond to ground?
  • What options do we have for bonding to ground??
  • When do we use a MOCA filter?

RFoG_Optical_Network_Unit_ONU_.title: RFoG Optical Network Unit (ONU)
RFoG_Optical_Network_Unit_ONU_.description: Serves as a mini-node in a FTTH demarc supporting RF over Glass (RFoG).
RFoG_Optical_Network_Unit_ONU_.html: The RFoG ONU acts as a mini-node, converting optical signals in the downstream for voice, video, and data into RF, to be carried over the customer’s inside wire to the cable modem, gateway, or set top box. In the upstream, the ONU converts RF into optical signals to be carried back to the hub or headend over the fiberoptic cable.

Security_Panel.title: Security Panel
Security_Panel.description: Configures and controls security and home automation devices installed by the cable operator.
Security_Panel.html:
Learn more...
  • What is home automation?
  • What is the Internet of Things (IoT)?
  • What is UHD?
  • What is Xfinity Home?
  • What is IntelligentHome?
  • What is Suddenlink Security?

Server.title: Server
Server.description: Provides storage and retrieval of web pages, configuration files, and logs of system and device status.
Server.html:
Learn more...
  • What is a server?
  • What is a web server?
  • What is UHD?
  • What is Xfinity Home?
  • What is IntelligentHome?
  • What is Suddenlink Security?

Shrink_Tube.title: Shrink Tube
Shrink_Tube.description: Protects hardline connectors from the elements.
Shrink_Tube.html: A heat gun or torch is used to shrink the tubing

Splice_Case.title: Splice Case
Splice_Case.description: Secures the fiber splices in a protective case.
Splice_Case.html:
Used aerially or in a pedestal. The splice case is available in a variety of sizes and configurations. Designed with fiberoptic cable slack, stored using the sno shoes, the case can be easily removed and placed in a splicing truck, out of the weather.
  • Commscope Splice Cases

Splitter.title: Splitter
Splitter.description: Splits and combines the RF signals to support multiple CPE devices.
Splitter.html:
Passively splits the downstream and combines the upstream RF signals at the customer location.
  • What are the losses through a splitter?

Strand.title: Strand
Strand.description: Attaches to utility poles to support aerial cable and electronics in the OSP.
Strand.html: Strand is stranded galvanized steel cable, available in 1/4", 5/16", and 3/8" diameters. Strand is also called messenger and is connected to utility poles. Strand can support thousands of pounds.

Strand_Suspension_Clamp.title: Strand Suspension Clamp
Strand_Suspension_Clamp.description: Secures strand to pole or support
Strand_Suspension_Clamp.html: Galvanized steel clamps are used on poles to secure the strand in place and are available in straight-through (shown) or corner pole (right angle).

TV_Receive_Only_Dish.title: TV Receive Only Dish
TV_Receive_Only_Dish.description: The TV Receive-only (TVRO) antenna receives programming from national networks at the headend.
TV_Receive_Only_Dish.html: The RF signal received by the antenna is typically a modulated MPEG4 stream which has to be converted to an MPEG2 transport stream. The RF signal from the antenna is routed to a integrated receiver transcoder (IRT) for this process.

Tap.title: Tap
Tap.description: Splits the downstream RF spectrum to multiple drop cables and combines the upstreams from the drops.
Tap.html: Taps are available in 2, 4, and 8 ports and in varying dB levels of attenuation.

Transcoder.title: Transcoder
Transcoder.description: Converts the Integrated Receiver Decoder (IRD) output signal to a format that can be connected to the hub router and switch.
Transcoder.html: The IRD decodes the digital data from the satellite and rebuilds it into a signal compatible with other headend/hub processing equipment.

Transport_Stream_TS_Analyzer.title: Transport Stream (TS) Analyzer
Transport_Stream_TS_Analyzer.description: Demodulates the ASI and QAM transport streams so they can be checked for quality.

TV.title: TV
TV.description: A TV displays and outputs the program information (video, audio, guide, metadata)
TV.html:
Learn more...
  • What is TV resolution?
  • What is aspect ratio?
  • What is UHD?
  • What is HDMI 2.0?
  • What is RoKu?
  • What is ChromeCast?
  • How do I program a remote?

WiFi_Thermostat.title: WiFi Thermostat
WiFi_Thermostat.description: Operates on the Internet of Things (IoT). May be configured, operated, and monitored over the internet.
WiFi_Thermostat.html: WiFi thermostats are part of the growing trend in home automation.

Wireless_Hub.title: Wireless Hub
Wireless_Hub.description: Provides access to the Internet and to the carrier's private network using WiFi.
Wireless_Hub.html: Also known as a Hotspot, the WiFi hub broadcasts multiple network names for use by mobile and fixed devices nearby. These hubs enable Internet access similar to a wireless router in the home.

Adjustable_Wrenches.title: Adjustable Wrenches
Adjustable_Wrenches.description: Tightens and loosens connectors and splices.

Anti-Static_Trim_and_Alignment_Tools.title: Anti-Static Trim and Alignment Tools
Anti-Static_Trim_and_Alignment_Tools.description: Adjusts internal amp components - made of anti-static material.

Cleaner_Scraper.title: Cleaner/Scraper
Cleaner_Scraper.description: Removes waste dielectric from the center conductor after coring.

Cordless_Heat_Gun.title: Cordless Heat Gun
Cordless_Heat_Gun.description: Shrinks the tubing around connectors to make a weather-resistant seal.

Foot-Pound_Torque_Wrench.title: Foot-Pound Torque Wrench
Foot-Pound_Torque_Wrench.description: Ensures proper torque on case bolts in order to make sure the case gasket is not deformed as the bolts are tightened.

Hardline_Coring_Tool.title: Hardline Coring Tool
Hardline_Coring_Tool.description: Removes the dielectric foam inside the hardline cable to prep it for a connector.

Inch-Pound_Torque_Wrench.title: Inch-Pound Torque Wrench
Inch-Pound_Torque_Wrench.description: Tightens connectors to specified torque to avoid deforming gaskets.

Pliers_Set.title: Pliers Set
Pliers_Set.description: Grabs, holds,  tightens, and loosens the fittings found in the OSP.

Screwdriver_Set.title: Screwdriver Set
Screwdriver_Set.description: Tightens and loosens seizure screws and used for general purposes where needed.

Socket_and_Box_Wrench_Kit.title: Socket and Box Wrench Kit
Socket_and_Box_Wrench_Kit.description: Loosens and tightens bolts on multiple devices and support gear in the OSP.
